intro: Diplostephium boyacense, commonly known as the Boyacá diplostephium, is a flowering plant native to Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, thriving in tropical and subtropical climates. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. The flowers are small and yellow, often grouped into dense clusters that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
